comment._content: This is only one step of the harvest process.  The stooks or shocks still have to be threshed to separate the oats from the chaff.

comment.author: 77186322@N07
comment._content: I helped harvest wheat, oats and barley but the worst was barley. After the gain was cut and bundled, we stacked in in shocks to dry for a week or more, then loaded it on wagons and hauled it to the Thrashing Machine. It was a dusty, dirty job but we competed for the fastest wagon record! Will -------- born 1925
